derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from French, literally ('that) pinches (the) nose'

entry.def: Pince-nez are old-fashioned glasses that consist of two lenses that fit tightly onto the top of your nose and do not have parts that rest on your ears.

example.ex: His secretary was a tall woman in pince-nez.
example.tran: 他的秘书是位戴着夹鼻眼镜的高个女士。

means.word_mean: 1. spectacles clipped to the nose by a spring
